snippet: The organization that supplies Major League Soccer with its on-field officials announced that it was locking out referees because of a labor dispute.
abstract: Major League Soccer will open its 19th season with replacement referees as the Professional Referee Organization announces lock out over labor dispute; negotiations have become increasingly testy in recent months, and two sides remain far apart on salaries and fees for officials.

byline.original: By ANDREW DAS and JACK BELL

lead_paragraph: The organization that supplies Major League Soccer with its on-field officials announced that it was locking out referees because of a labor dispute.

headline.main: M.L.S. to Open Season With Replacement Referees Amid Lockout
headline.print_headline: M.L.S. to Open Season With Replacement Referees Amid Lockout
